The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:
Holcim Building Envelope is dedicated to protecting employees, the community,
and the environment from highly hazardous incidents through safely operating
our facility.
Our overall approach and commitment to chemical safety is demonstrated
through the existing management, training, procedural, and maintenance systems
in place at the facility and the hazard assessment, prevention program and
emergency response provisions implemented for the covered process. The site
has an integrated management system to ensure safety is documented in the
facility's RMP program as well as compliance with applicable regulations, codes,
and standards such as OSHAs Process Safety Management (PSM) Program under
29 CFR 1910.119.
Our facility and the regulated substances handled:
Holcim Building Envelope is a distribution warehouse located in Plainfield,
Indiana. The warehouse handles, stores and distributes various materials for the
manufacture of building products, particularly insulation. There is no chemical
processing or manufacturing at the warehouse. The covered process entails the
receipt, handling, and storage of various products in small containers. Some of
the products are regulated flammable mixtures which include pentane, ethylene
and propylene. The quantity of the covered products stored in the warehouse can
fluctuate based on the season, therefore a conservative approach was taken in
determining the maximum intended inventory for the covered products.
Due to the flammability of the products mentioned above, the Plainfield facility is
covered by OSHA's PSM Program and therefore required to comply with EPA's
RMP Program 3 requirements.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific
prevention steps:
Holcim Building Envelope has developed an integrated approach to compliance
through a PSM/RMP Manual. The manual describes the management system and
associated procedures and do

cumentation related to the OSHA PSM/RMP
Prevention Program Level 3 elements, Emergency Response, and Risk
Management Plan submittal. This manual includes relevant Process Safety

Information documentation and references; procedures and information for
Process Hazard Analysis; references to the facility Operating Procedures and
discussion of how they are maintained; a description of training activities and
references to training management documentation; applicable safe work
practices; procedures for maintenance activities including inspection, testing and
preventive maintenance instructions; procedures for Management of
Change/Pre-Startup Safety Review; a procedure for conducting 3-year Compliance
Audits, management of contractors; and references to corporate Incident
Investigation procedures. The manual also includes detailed Hazard Assessment
and Risk Management Plan submittal information.
The five-year accident history:
At the time of this RMP submission, there are no RMP-related accidents to report.
The emergency response program:
The Holcim Building Envelope warehouse maintains an emergency action plan
which is in place to protect workers and public safety as well as the environment.
The warehouse is a defensive facility and relies on local responders when there is
a need. The program consists of procedures for evacuating the warehouse and
making notifications to appropriate emergency personnel. The Distribution Center
Manager coordinates at least annually with the Plainfield Fire Department to
ensure they will be prepared to respond to an emergency at the warehouse. Site
employees are regularly trained on the emergency action plan including
identification of potential emergency situations, response notification and
evacuation.
Planned changes to improve safety:
Our facility continually evaluates and implements corrective actions resulting
from process safety activities such as Process Hazard Analyses (PHAs), incident
investigations, and compliance audits. Holc

im Building Envelope also has an
established network through the leadership team to share incident and near miss
learnings across the organization. Toward continuous improvement, the Plainfield
site is currently working to improve safety by implementing recommendations
from the most recent PHA.
